content: The auto update is the default, but can be set to not do that. Older versions are available at https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/ - I suggest making a copy of the profile folder at the ...appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder, uninstalling the new version, installing your preferred version, and setting the auto update to no. You may need to remove a compatibility.ini file in the profile if you get message of incompatibility.
creator: davidsk

content: David, thank you for that but my point is that I had auto update turned off! It's been turned off for years because every update was rendering QuickText incompatible.
creator: adastron

content:
It's possible you have a security app like Norton that includes an updater that overrides the setting in TB.

https://support.norton.com/sp/en/us/home/current/solutions/v20240108182413203?

There is a version of Quicktext for TB 140: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1521896

If QT is the only add-on you need, it's probably better to stick with 140 instead of downgrading to an older version.
creator: sfhowes

content: Thanks everyone. I use AVG and I couldn't find anything that would overide a setting not to automatically upgrade. In any case I can live with TB 140 because the workaround to download the Quicktext install file in a browser other than Firefox did the trick. I'm happy now. Thanks again.
creator: adastron

content: So, you believe the AVG Updater is not active on your system?
creator: sfhowes

content: Are you talking about the Driver Updater? That's the only AVG Updater I have.
creator: adastron

content: The Driver and Software updaters are separate.
creator: sfhowes

content: Finally found the software updater and it was set to manual. There is a recommendation to update TB but it hasn't actioned. In any case TB 140 and Quicktext are running happily.
creator: adastron

content:
And you can get the latest prerelease of version v6.3.6 out today at https://github.com/jobisoft/quicktext/releases/tag/v6.3.6. You can download the xpi file, and in Thunderbird use Add-ons, click the gear icon, and choose "Install from file" to pick the downloaded xpi file.

FYI the delay has been that, for various reasons, Quicktext is being rewritten. The most important reason is to change it to pure Webextensions (well documented by our excellent add-ons support developer), which means it will be far less sensitive to Thunderbird version changes.

The author informs me that once this rewrite is complete then the community can more easily contribute code. For now, the best way to help is to test quicktext v6 using the instructions at https://github.com/jobisoft/quicktext/issues/439.
creator: wsmwk

content: Thanks Wayne That's good to know.
creator: adastron

content: First, this forum is staffed volunteers, not developers. We cope with upgrades the same as everyone else. The auto update feature can be turned off, although I admit it's the default. My guess is that thunderbird may have created a new profile. Were you prompted to create an email address? The old profile should still be available. Try this: help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' and see if there is a second, inactive, profile there. If so, see if you can launch it.
creator: davidsk

content: Please add more detail on your problem. Including a screenshot may help.

content:
Hello there We have read that message We try to help.


Being blacklisted is not a Thunderbird issue on the blacklist and Thunderbird is not. You can make contact with that email provider for what reason that blacklist is created.

Are you using mail provider svthen contact them for more information. Try to find out what that reason is that you are on that so called blacklist there? Try to use temporarily other email client s for some moments to see if that issue is really only there at Thunderbird (try to use webmail for a second and them come back to Thunderbird.) That other email program Outlook or Gmail that is been used there in combination with Thunderbird client and Is become being blocked with that ip adres , if you can contact your email provider to solve that issue and ask permission there to get of there blacklist to go on that so called white list and continue to use that provider and try to get on that approved so called white list and use Thunderbird again after that solved problem there. For having a good day again with us .

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
Hello there Being on the blacklist there it means you can receive emails normally.That blacklist only focus on the outgoing mail , that means there is no option to send mail because you went blocked for a period of time.

The most common things around for being blocked that way is that you are sending spam messages , maybe that you are sending these mails without knowing , misbehaviour is one of the common populair subjects to get blocked and to send mail again. Other emails has to be delivered are blocked by the email server even if there is some sort of incoming mail to that inbox all of the other mail is being blocked to by that presented email server for your mail that day.

What you might not see is that a lot of mail that is going around from your account that is called in the year 2025 spammy mail , that kind of mail is not really spam but a little bit spam. It might being recognised by other human when searching for these spam or anti spam bots that might have matched that issue again of the new spreading misbehaviours. Providers has owning there own list of blacklists so they can help you out if you make a clear call to them or by sending them that email to arrange a deal. To stay of that blacklist is by you. Relax and seek for these trusted feedbacks of friends or colleagues to solve this fix and show it to the present providers contact.

Greetings googlethunderbird.
creator: Googlethunderbird.

content:
The first column (27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32) is the week number, not the date of the previous month.

You can hide week numbers using the following steps: "Settings" > "Calendar" > Untick "Show week number in views and minimonth". (Please see the attached image.)

content:
Potrebbe essere un bug delle versioni recenti, dato che c'è stata almeno una segnalazione simile alla tua. Hai lo stesso comportamento in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird

Per poter inquadrare il problema prova inoltre a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

Al momento l'unica soluzione che mi viene in mente è quella di tornare alla versione precedente di Thunderbird, preferibilmente:

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail problematiche -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]
creator: @next

content:
La cause possono essere molte, le prime che mi vengono in mente: - con il protocollo IMAP le mail sono state cancellate dal server o da qualche altra applicazione - il database delle mail è danneggiato - l'indice delle mail è danneggiato

Per gli ultimi due problemi prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella problematica -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Infine esiste in Thunderbird un terzo strumento di ricerca, meno intuitivo ma più potente che puoi provare Tasto menu > Strumenti > Ricerca messaggi

çok video izledim her zaman seçilen ayar 587 Bağlantı türü ; hiçbiri ve normal parola şeklinde yapılmış.

creator: sfhowes

content:
Perhaps you could try to adjust your SMTP server port settings. Outlook servers support both ports 587 (STARTTLS) and also port 465 (SSL/TLS). Sometimes one breaks after updates.

  • Port 465: A legacy port for SMTPS (SMTP over SSL/TLS). While still used, it's generally recommended to use port 587 with STARTTLS for more-secure email transmission. Try this one and see if that fixes your issue for the time being.
  • Port 587: Is the recommended port for secure SMTP communication (SMTP with STARTTLS) when sending emails.

I think you already know how to do this: But (on desktop) go to thunderbird-> Account Settings -> (btm right) Edit SMTP Server. Then change the port and type to match the above:(port 465, SSL/TLS, Normal Password)

Let me know if this helped!
creator: Thundamike

content: Thanks for the idea, though unfortunately that didn't help: tried 465 + SSL/TLS and got a server did not respond/could not be reached error (same with 465 + STARTTLS, though I'd assumed that wouldn't work anyway). Switching back to 587 + STARTTLS still gives timeouts as before.

creator: james43

content:
Thanks for your prompt replies James.

Please try the following if you haven't already:

1. Please try removing the add-on. Generally, Thunderbird Troubleshoot mode works but sometimes it doesn't! 2. Please try disabling all 3rd party software including anti-virus (often anti-virus blocks Thunderbird updates) as you probably know but can't hurt to try. (I know you tried disabling the firewall) 3. " work runs an Outlook/Microsoft mail server" <-- Have you tried filing a support request with your Microsoft admin? Microsoft runs a diversity :-) of email servers and can often change them unpredictably without warning which can result in SMTP i.e. sending email failing.

Cheers! ...Roland

content:
Corollary:

The Date header for my email:

Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2025 14:24:06 +0000

By default it displays correctly as having been received on July 17 2025 00:24 +1000. And that's what the Received header says.

When I set the TZ=Australia/AEST environment variable, I get this:

Received: Thu, 17 Jul 2025 00:24:14 +1000 Date: Wed, 16 Jul 2025 14:24:06 +0000

But now the Date header is displayed. So the headers themselves are consistent. But they are being swapped (i.e. the datetime that displays in the UI) depending on whether I set the environment variable or not.

content:
Just to clarify, the guideline is to NOT use zip if the profile is over 2 gig. I will post here the solution that has always worked. This assumes Windows and that you use the default profile folder location,

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
Jerry Cutting said
Peer Certification expiration - Why is this Pop-up showing up after many years of thunderbird use and why does it prevent receiving and sending emails. It wants a certificate or an exception with out adequate explanation or guidance.
A really good starting point would be to view the certificate offered and see who issued it. Probably your antivirus messing up. But I am biased about the waste of time and effort caused by email scanning. I did check the domains certificates and they are all ok. https://www.immuniweb.com/ssl/mail.ody.ca/8qyUTXs4/
I did not have account set up and because I couldn.t receive email confirmation could not seek help. I contacted Norton who appeared on the company example and they could not resolve. Given I could not get access thunderbird for assistance, I did an uninstall and reinstall. I lost my addresses but at least I was able to sent and receive emails again. the Pop up had gone away. I set up my second email and when I completed this set up I was greeted by this pop-up. What is this all about and what are the risks. How is it resolved?

As I said, view the certificate and see who is issuing it.

I have no idea where Norton comes into this. I see nothing in the image to indicate they have anything to do with this. Are they your antivirus provider or just how did you get to them as the "Norton who appeared on the company example" if you clicked view to get them, they are exactly who can help you. If not whom ever issued the certificates can probably help you. In the interim, I suggest you disable your antivirus and see if the issue goes away. That would at least identify if I am on the right track.

content:
Je pravdepodobné, že máte narušený profil Thunderbirdu. Vytvorte si NOVÝ PROFIL. Na vytvorenie nového profilu môžete použiť príkazy v ponuke Štart (WIN+R) a tu vypíšte: "thunderbird -p" - bez úvodzoviek a preverte, či problém pretrváva. Ak problém nepominie, tak sa môžete prepnúť späť k pôvodnému profilu tiež príkazom "thunderbird -p" http://imgbank.cz/images/2015/08/20/Thunderbird_novy_profil.jpg

Do NOVÉHO PROFILU si potom cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO (pôvodného) profilu Thunderbirdu - zvoľte si iba to čo potrebujete. https://imgbank.cz/images/2023/10/25/Thunderbird_import.jpg

Ak je problém odstránený, potom pokračujte v tvorbe (budovaní) NOVÉHO PROFILU Thunderbirdu. Nakoniec môžete ten STARÝ profil odstrániť.

=

Návrat k staršej verzii Thunderbirdu je možný. Stiahnite si potrebnú oficiálnu verziu Thunderbirdu. Vypnite Thunderbird a natvrdo preinštalujte doterajšiu (problémovú) verziu Thunderbirdu. Všetky oficiálne verzie Thunderbirdu nájdete tuna: http://archive.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/

Po nainštalovaní vypnite automatické aktualizácie: - Thunderbird - Nástroje - Možnosti - Spresnenie - Aktualizacie A tu zvoľte „Nevyhľadávať aktualizácie“

Preneste si potrebné údaje cez "Nástroje“ - „Importovať" - „Importovať z inej inštalácie Thunderbirdu“ importujte všetky účty a nastavenia, adresáre, e-mailové správy a kalendár ... zo STARÉHO (pôvodného) profilu Thunderbirdu - zvoľte si iba to čo potrebujete.

content:
As far as I know the actual version no longer has settings to customise background colours. The Thunderbird main window user interface is composed of a patchwork of panes (folder pane, thread pane, message pane, today pane, .... in which you could change background colours by using CSS codes in a userChrome.css file in the profile. You would use these changes on your own risk https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/userchromecss-js-usercontent-unsupported

I began using userChrome.css tweaks thirteen years ago when decent third party themes were no longer available for macOS; I couldn't stand the gloomy gray-white default theme...
creator: Mapenzi
